articles.author: Olivia Willis, Nakari Thorpe, Carl Smith
articles.title: 'Devil devil': The sickness that changed Australia - ABC News
articles.description: In 1789, a disease tore through communities around Sydney Cove leaving dead bodies scattered along the shorelines. Some think this outbreak was a fire deliberately lit.

articles.author: Ian Verrender
articles.title: How Beijing shot itself in the foot with its trade war with Australia - ABC News
articles.description: Much to the chagrin of the Beijing bureaucracy, Australian trade is booming, driving a rapid turnaround from the COVID-inspired crunch that crippled the global economy last year, writes Ian Verrender.
articles.content:
What's that old saying? Never start a war unless you know you can win.
Which brings us nicely to the topic of China and its rapidly deteriorating relationship with Australia.

articles.title: 'Irresponsible': Rape survivors' advocates Louise Nicholas and HELP slam TVNZ's Craig McLachlan interview - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: The 90-minute prime time special is an extended interview with Australian actor Craig McLachlan, who was found not guilty on sexual assault charges.
articles.content:
Leading advocates for victims of sexual harm have slammed TVNZs decision to air a 90-minute special about Australian actor Craig McLachlan, calling it disappointing and irresponsible.

articles.description: Tommy Little and the Federal Secretary for Australian Nursing and Midwifery Federation (ANWF) Annie Butler have clashed in a fiery exchange over the Covid vaccine.
articles.content:

articles.title: Car Crashes Into Japanese Arcade, Thankfully No One Was Hurt - Kotaku Australia
articles.description: Last week in Hiroshima, a sedan plowed into an arcade at a little after 9 pm, knocking over a row of bicycles and smashing through glass. The game centre was still in operation, and fortunately, no one in the car or arcade was hurt. In the above image from FN…

articles.title: The cartel of Australian Mr Bigs responsible for $1.5b drug imports - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Nine men drawn from Australian bikie gangs, Asian triads and Middle Eastern crime syndicates make up what criminal intelligence authorities have called the ‘Aussie Cartel’.
articles.content: Some official sources have confirmed that two members of the cartel in particular are believed to have government insiders in Australia and overseas in their networks. Mr Phelan confirmed federal law… [+3775 chars]

articles.title: Victoria records four new cases of Covid-19 - RNZ
articles.description: The Australian state of Victoria has recorded four new positive Covid-19 cases, two being primary close contacts of existing cases, and two in an aged care facility in Melbourne.
